meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a setose body, making it look prickly.
meanings.sent2: The hedgehog's setose coat provided protection from predators.
meanings.sent3: The setose cactus seemed to be giving out free hugs.
meanings.sent4: Her setose hair stood on end in the chilly wind.
meanings.sent5: The setose surface felt like a rough carpet underfoot.

meanings.sent1: The setose plant leaves were rough to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The setose caterpillar crawled slowly along the branch.
meanings.sent3: The setose brush tickled his face as he painted.
meanings.sent4: The setose thorns on the rose bush were like tiny daggers.
meanings.sent5: The setose texture of the fabric irritated her skin.

meanings.sent1: The setose surface of the fruit felt rough against her lips.
meanings.sent2: The setose cat's fur stood on end when it was scared.
meanings.sent3: The setose broom swept up the mess with ease.
meanings.sent4: The setose branches scratched at the window in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The setose texture of the rug made it uncomfortable to walk on.
